column4: Hi everybody, I've just added 2 disks to my system, and they are being seen by the bios but not by any software. (/dev/disk/by-id/ shows just my old disks) What can I do?
how about dmesg? do they show up there?
are these plain jane ide drives?
can you try with another  os live cd?
I've tried two different liveCD's and a third didn't boot (though it used to, go figure) What do I search for in dmesg?
did you get that? do you have any raid setup and what is your chipset?
I think you can do lspci -v |grep IDE
they are not raided, and are on a Marvell 88SE61XX
Yhat is not the MOBO I'm using, does it matter (it is the correct chip)
not sure but thats the only driver I could find
right now you prob have ide_generic (check with lsmod)
After some research i found pata_marvell (wich is the module that is loaded) should work in legacy mode, for the first two ports. I will reboot and try that. Thanks so far!
